Name: Cosimo de' Medici(Pater Patriae)
Relationship with predecessor: Son of Giovanni di Bicci de' Medici who was not as prominently involved in Florentine politics, rather more involved in the financial area.

Name: Piero I de' Medici(Piero the Gouty)
Relationship with predecessor: Eldest son of Cosimo de' Medici.

Name: Lorenzo I de' Medici(Lorenzo the Magnificent)
Relationship with predecessor: Eldest son of Piero I de' Medici.

Name: Piero II de' Medici(Piero the Unfortunate)
Relationship with predecessor: Eldest son of Lorenzo the Magnificent. Overthrown when Charles VIII of France invaded as a full republic was restored, first under the theocracy of Girolamo Savonarola and then statesman Piero Soderini.

Name: Cardinal Giovanni de' Medici
Relationship with predecessor: Brother of Piero the Unfortunate, second son of Lorenzo the Magnificent. Elected to the Papacy, becoming Pope Leo X.
